item.title: Bins repeatedly mishandled by collection team ‚Äî recycling left on street and food bins thrown, rubbish scattered on MOSSLEA ROAD, 3rd October
item.description:
I am writing to raise a complaint about the conduct of the waste collection team on my street. On multiple occasions, I have witnessed unacceptable behaviour from the bin crews. Instead of handling bins with care, they often throw food and recycling bins around, leaving rubbish scattered across the street. Most recently, the contents of my recycling bin were left on the ground, and the team simply walked past without bothering to pick it up. This shows a lack of respect both for residents and for the work they are employed to do. The amount of litter and disruption left behind after collections is not only unsightly but also an embarrassment to the service. I expect a higher standard of care and professionalism, and I would like to know what steps will be taken to address this. Please investigate this matter and ensure that waste collection teams are reminded of their responsibilities to the community.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mosslea Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: In Floyd Road just below junction with Church Lane, 3rd October
item.description:
Piles of bin bags alongside overflowing commercial waste bins. This situation has been going on for MONTHS and the only response is that it will be "dealt with at the next scheduled sweep". And when, pray, might that be?There have been multiple reports of this disgusting health hazard on Fix My Street this week and alleged "Fixed" status which is false. And no I have no intention of becoming an Environmental Champion expected to remove this ¬£%*$ myself. I don't even live in the street but have to pass this stinking pile every day. Get a grip RBG and DEAL WITH THIS ONCE AND FOR ALL.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Floyd Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Recycling bin not emptied, 3rd October
item.description:
Resident reports: ‚ÄúAs a frequent user of the recycling bins in Chislehurst car park, I have noticed that one of the plastics bins hasn't been cleared for over 6 weeks. Is there any reason for that, do you know? thank you‚Äù Can you investigate please? Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Chislehurst, London

item.title: On the road, outside of 24 England's Lane., 3rd October
item.description:
A broken section of asphalt and indentation in the road surface on England's Lane causes strong vibrations in neighbouring buildings when heavy electric buses pass over it. As a result, damage is beginning to appear on internal walls.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, England's Lane, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet
